abstracts.cdata!:
The International Road Corridor
            Rehabilitation Project aims to secure, over the medium-term,
            an acceptable level of service on the Djibouti-Galafi Road
            which constitutes Djibouti Port's transit corridor to
            Ethiopia, during the period when a long-term corridor
            improvement scheme is being developed and implemented by the
            Ethiopian and Djibouti governments with assistance from the
            European Union. The project consists of eleven components.
            They can be separated into two implementation phases: in the
            initial phase, quick rehabilitation and repairs of road
            between the Arta turnoff and Galaif, on the Ethiopia border
            over a period of about one year; and a second three-year
            phase covering road maintenance, construction of axle load
            control stations, and technical assistance to support
            institutional development. Phase I would have the following
            components: 1) civil works between Dikhil and Galafi, 2)
            civil works between Arta and Dikhil, and 3) rehabilitation
            of Roads Department's equipment pool. Phase II will
            have the following components: 4) routine maintenance of the
            entire Arta-spur to Galafi; 5) axle load control station; 6)
            project implementation unit; 7) construction management
            consultant and supervision of the works; 8) offices,
            vehicles and laboratory equipment for supervising engineer,
            construction manager, and Project Implementation Unit; 9)
            institutional development support,10) studies on HIV/AIDS
            and road safety, and 11) study on development of
            trade-related services.
